question: Does KLF2 regulate myeloid cell activation and determine outcomes during polymicrobial infection and endotoxemia in vivo? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Herein, we identify the Kruppel-like transcription factor 2 (KLF2) as a potent regulator of myeloid cell activation in vivo.
content.source_2: Myeloid KLF2 did not inhibit nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-κB)-dependent HIF-1α transcription and, consequently, was not a determinant of outcome in models of polymicrobial infection and endotoxemia.
content.source_3: Rather than acting as a tonic repressor, KLF2 enhanced myeloid cell activation in vivo and was dispensable for maintaining appropriate innate immune regulation.
